TypeSignature.Value: .class nested public auto ansi sealed ADODC/BOFActionEnum extends System.Enum

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.* classes are obsolete and supported within 32 bit processes only. http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=160862")

Docs.summary: Provides constants for compatibility with the Visual Basic 6.0 property.

remarks.format:
## Remarks In Visual Basic 6.0, the `BOFAction` property was used to determine what action the `ADODC` takes when the `BOF` property is true.
These constants enable code that has been upgraded from Visual Basic 6.0 to continue to run without additional modification.
> [!NOTE] > Functions and objects in the <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6> namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)]. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] implementation.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC/BOFActionEnum adDoMoveFirst = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Keeps the first record as the current record.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.ADODC/BOFActionEnum adStayBOF = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Moving past the start of a triggers the event on the first record, followed by a Reposition event on the invalid (BOF) record. At this point, the **Move Previous** button on the is disabled.
